page.title: 14Pedigree Ayrshires.
page.content: { Mr.Jones,of Hayford Farm,}keeps pedi- gree Ayrshires because they give good quality milk with plenty of protein. When calves are born they have a number tattooed in their right ear.Mr. Jones showed us a calf.Its number was {L147454.}The L stands for the year,14 is for the 14th calf born this year and 7454 is the herd number.He pays{Â£5 for every calf to be registered in the {Ayrshire society.}Bull calves go to Shrewsbury market at two weeks old.He keeps one occasionally for breeding.He keeps his heifers.When they are two and a half years old they have a calf and start to give milk.They are milked for 305 days and then left dry for 2 months,then have another calf.Records are kept so that the best milkers are used for breeding.The milk goes to {Minsterley Creamery}for yogurt,cottage cheese,dried milk and cream.
